repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
See https://github.com/Kotlin/kotlin-lsp/issues/105 probably this should be fixed in the language server also, but makes sense to fallback to label like we do in other cases. As is this causes an empty string to be inserted during lsp ins-completion.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: Nit: We usually use `snake_case` for Lua variable names.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -191,7 +191,12 @@ local function get_completion_word(item, prefix, match)
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
     local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local whitespaceTrimmedWord = word:match('^(%S*)') or word

comment_data.body:
I don't think that falling back to the label here is correct. The docs of [`CompletionItem`](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#completionItem) don't mention falling back to the label if the text edit text is empty.

Note how we fallback to the label when `insertText` is empty, as that is indeed documented on the protocol. However that doesn't seem to be the case here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -191,7 +191,12 @@ local function get_completion_word(item, prefix, match)
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
     local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local whitespaceTrimmedWord = word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    if whitespaceTrimmedWord ~= '' then
+      return whitespaceTrimmedWord
+    else
+      return item.label

comment_data.body: Hmm that is a bummer since [TextEdit](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#textEdit) explicitly calls out empty `newText` as indicating deletion. It's a reach, but my guess is that in the context of completion deletion is never intended. Still, I would understand if we don't want to implement the spec wrong for one misbehaving LS.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -191,7 +191,12 @@ local function get_completion_word(item, prefix, match)
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
     local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local whitespaceTrimmedWord = word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    if whitespaceTrimmedWord ~= '' then
+      return whitespaceTrimmedWord
+    else
+      return item.label

comment_data.body:
> my guess is that in the context of completion deletion is never intended

Agree with you there, but yeah I'm not a fan of interpreting the fields of `TextEdit`s differently based on the request.

Also based on [the linked issue](https://github.com/Kotlin/kotlin-lsp/issues/105) it sounds like this is also happening in other editors, and hence I would prefer we don't work around the server.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -191,7 +191,12 @@ local function get_completion_word(item, prefix, match)
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
     local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local whitespaceTrimmedWord = word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    if whitespaceTrimmedWord ~= '' then
+      return whitespaceTrimmedWord
+    else
+      return item.label

comment_regular_data.body:
> fallback to label like we do in other cases

Just for reference can you point to the other case(s)? In code, or if this discussed recently

> > fallback to label like we do in other cases
> 
> Just for reference can you point to the other case(s)? In code, or if this discussed recently

On line [167](https://github.com/josuf107/neovim/blob/bc4e6c100260c85c283561fde99439eb4a974165/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua#L167) and line [200](https://github.com/josuf107/neovim/blob/bc4e6c100260c85c283561fde99439eb4a974165/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua#L200) we check if insertText is blank and fallback to label if it is, so there's some precedent for "the field is there but it's blank so we won't use it"
Is there a path forward here or should this be closed?

> Is there a path forward here or should this be closed?

Let's close this. @josuf107 I do appreciate the desire to contribute here! But yes this is just an editor bandaid for something that the Kotlin LSP is doing incorrectly.
Appreciate your time sorry I hadn't read the LSP spec first. Too bad kotlin-lsp is mostly closed source :(

> Appreciate your time sorry I hadn't read the LSP spec first. Too bad kotlin-lsp is mostly closed source :(

No worries, I understand your pain ðŸ«

title: fix(lsp): fallback to label if lsp completion item newText is blank
